, known as the gateway to the nearby Oregon Caves National Monument.
.  To get to the Oregon Caves, turn onto Oregon 46 and follow it 20 miles (32 km) to the monument.

value: address=19000 Caves Hwy, Cave Junction, OR 97523
hours=Daily between spring to Thanksgiving, hours and tour frequencies vary, see website for details
price=$8.50 adults, $6.00 children (to 16), group rates available (12 or more)

content=Declared a National Monument by President William Howard Taft, the centerpiece of this attraction are the marble caves with unique rock formations.  National Park Service rangers conduct guided tours on regular schedules.  Bring a jacket as the temperature in the caves is a constant 43°F (6°C) year-round.
